requirement_summary: Obligation to publish a crypto-asset white paper
description: Published white paper for each crypto-asset offered to the public or admitted to trading, notified to the competent authority at least 20 working days before publication, containing all mandatory disclosures per Article 6
auditor_questions: Show me the published white paper and proof of notification to the competent authority
How do you ensure the white paper is kept up to date with material changes?
What is your process for ensuring fair, clear and not misleading information in the white paper?
Show me evidence that the white paper was published on your website before the offering date

maturity_levels.basic: White paper published with mandatory content, notification sent to competent authority
maturity_levels.intermediate: Version-controlled white paper with change log, legal review process for updates
maturity_levels.advanced: Automated compliance checks against Article 6 requirements, real-time update tracking with regulatory notification workflow

requirement_summary: Content of the crypto-asset white paper
description: Documentation demonstrating the white paper contains all required information: description of the offeror, description of the crypto-asset project, rights and obligations, underlying technology, risks, and adverse environmental impacts
auditor_questions: Show me how each mandatory content element from Article 6 is addressed in your white paper
How do you disclose risks associated with the crypto-asset to potential purchasers?
What information do you provide about the underlying distributed ledger technology?
How do you disclose the adverse environmental and climate-related impacts of the consensus mechanism?

maturity_levels.basic: All mandatory content sections present in white paper
maturity_levels.intermediate: Detailed risk disclosures, third-party legal review, plain language summaries
maturity_levels.advanced: Dynamic risk disclosures updated with market conditions, environmental impact quantification, multi-language versions

requirement_summary: Obligations of offerors and persons seeking admission to trading of asset-referenced tokens
description: Policy documenting the obligations of issuers of asset-referenced tokens including acting honestly, fairly and professionally, communicating in a fair, clear and not misleading manner, and acting in the best interests of holders
auditor_questions: Show me your governance framework for issuing asset-referenced tokens
How do you ensure communications to token holders are fair, clear and not misleading?
What conflict of interest procedures do you have in place for token issuance?
How do you act in the best interests of asset-referenced token holders?

maturity_levels.basic: Basic governance policy with documented obligations and conflict of interest procedures
maturity_levels.intermediate: Regular compliance monitoring, independent oversight function, documented decision-making
maturity_levels.advanced: Automated compliance controls, real-time conflict monitoring, independent governance audits

requirement_summary: Reserve of assets for asset-referenced tokens
description: Documentation of the reserve of assets backing asset-referenced tokens including composition, custody arrangements, segregation from own assets, and independent audit reports confirming reserve adequacy
auditor_questions: Show me the composition and valuation of the reserve of assets
How are reserve assets segregated from the issuer's own assets?
Who is the custodian of the reserve assets and what are the custody arrangements?
Show me the independent audit report confirming the reserve covers the value of tokens in circulation

maturity_levels.basic: Reserve maintained with basic composition documentation, custodian appointed
maturity_levels.intermediate: Regular independent audits, real-time reserve monitoring, diversified custody arrangements
maturity_levels.advanced: Continuous reserve attestation, automated rebalancing, multiple independent custodians with redundancy

requirement_summary: Rights of holders of asset-referenced tokens
artifact_name: Token Holder Rights and Redemption Procedure
description: Documented procedure for holders to exercise their right of redemption at any time, including the redemption process, timelines, and claim on the reserve of assets
auditor_questions: Show me the documented redemption procedure available to token holders
How do you ensure holders can redeem tokens at market value at any time?
What is the timeline for processing redemption requests?
How do holders exercise their claim on the reserve of assets?

maturity_levels.basic: Redemption procedure documented and communicated to holders
maturity_levels.intermediate: Automated redemption processing, clear SLAs, complaint resolution for redemption disputes
maturity_levels.advanced: Real-time redemption capability, smart contract-based automated redemption, transparent reserve visibility

requirement_summary: Authorization for issuers of e-money tokens
description: Evidence of authorization as a credit institution or electronic money institution for issuing e-money tokens, including the authorization decision and ongoing compliance with authorization conditions
auditor_questions: Show me your authorization as a credit institution or electronic money institution
How do you ensure ongoing compliance with the conditions of authorization?
What notifications have you made to the competent authority regarding e-money token issuance?
Show me the white paper for each e-money token issued

maturity_levels.basic: Authorization obtained, white paper published for each e-money token
maturity_levels.intermediate: Regular compliance reviews against authorization conditions, proactive regulatory engagement
maturity_levels.advanced: Automated compliance monitoring against authorization conditions, real-time regulatory reporting

description: Complete authorization application and decision from competent authority for crypto-asset service providers, including programme of operations, internal control mechanisms, business continuity arrangements, and governance structure
auditor_questions: Show me your CASP authorization decision from the competent authority
What crypto-asset services are you authorized to provide?
Show me your programme of operations submitted with the authorization application
How do you maintain compliance with all ongoing authorization conditions?

maturity_levels.basic: Authorization obtained with required documentation, basic compliance monitoring
maturity_levels.intermediate: Regular internal audits of authorization compliance, documented change management for service scope
maturity_levels.advanced: Continuous compliance monitoring, automated regulatory change impact assessment, proactive regulatory dialogue

requirement_summary: Prudential requirements for crypto-asset service providers
description: Documentation demonstrating compliance with prudential safeguards including minimum capital requirements (permanent minimum capital of the higher of EUR 50,000-150,000 depending on services or one quarter of fixed overheads), and professional indemnity insurance or comparable guarantee
auditor_questions: Show me evidence that you meet the minimum own funds requirements for your authorized services
How do you calculate your fixed overheads requirement?
Do you hold professional indemnity insurance and what does it cover?
Show me quarterly capital adequacy calculations

maturity_levels.basic: Capital requirements met, basic quarterly calculations performed
maturity_levels.intermediate: Monthly capital monitoring, stress testing of capital adequacy, insurance coverage reviewed annually
maturity_levels.advanced: Real-time capital monitoring dashboards, automated capital adequacy alerts, forward-looking capital planning

requirement_summary: Safeguarding of clients' crypto-assets and funds
description: Documented procedures for safeguarding clients' crypto-assets and funds, including segregation arrangements, custody controls, prohibition on using client assets for own account, and adequate organizational arrangements to minimize risk of loss
auditor_questions: Show me how clients' crypto-assets are segregated from the firm's own assets
What custody arrangements are in place and who are the custodians?
How do you ensure clients' funds are not used for the firm's own account?
What organizational arrangements minimize the risk of loss or diminution of client assets?

maturity_levels.basic: Segregation of client assets documented, basic custody controls in place
maturity_levels.intermediate: Independent custody verification, regular reconciliation, insurance coverage for client assets
maturity_levels.advanced: Real-time asset reconciliation, multi-signature custody with hardware security modules, independent third-party attestation

requirement_summary: Complaints handling procedures for crypto-asset service providers
description: Documented complaints handling procedure that is free of charge for clients, including templates for filing complaints, clear timelines for investigation and resolution, and record-keeping of all complaints and outcomes
auditor_questions: Show me your published complaints handling procedure
What is the timeline for acknowledging and resolving complaints?
Show me the complaints register with outcomes and resolution times
How do you inform clients of their right to complain and the procedure to follow?

maturity_levels.basic: Complaints procedure published, basic complaints register maintained
maturity_levels.intermediate: Tracked complaints with SLAs, root cause analysis, regular management reporting on complaints trends
maturity_levels.advanced: Automated complaints management system, predictive analytics on complaint patterns, integration with product improvement processes
